Articles.Content: After updating to v 1.4.4, my planes start bouncing during landing. I use mechjeb autopilot which brakes on landing, and the whole plane bounces around like crazy. I tuned down the spring strength already. Any solutions?

20 minutes ago, Xd the great said:

Depois de atualizar para o 1.4.4, meus aviões começam a saltar durante o pouso. Eu uso o piloto automático mechjeb que freia no pouso, e todo o avião pula como um louco. Eu afinei a força da primavera já. Alguma solução?

Good morning, the solution to this bug came out in the form of a mod: https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/169206-131-143-worldstabilizer-bugfix-for-vessels-bouncing-on- scene-load /

7 hours ago, Catatau_27 said:

Good morning, the solution to this bug came out in the form of a mod: https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/169206-131-143-worldstabilizer-bugfix-for-vessels-bouncing-on- scene-load /

Different issue, but a possible fix. 

Xd, use smaller gear, they're usually less bouncy.   Also a good sized recent thread on this very topic with some good answers in it... that I cannot find to link for you.  It might have been by @Klapaucius, but I'm probably wrong there....

Edited July 1, 2018 by Gargamel

10 hours ago, Catatau_27 said:

Good morning, the solution to this bug came out in the form of a mod: https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/169206-131-143-worldstabilizer-bugfix-for-vessels-bouncing-on- scene-load /

I have the mod, but it still bounces

3 hours ago, Gargamel said:

Different issue, but a possible fix. 

Xd, use smaller gear, they're usually less bouncy.   Also a good sized recent thread on this very topic with some good answers in it... that I cannot find to link for you.  It might have been by @Klapaucius, but I'm probably wrong there....

I use medium gears already.

If i use smaller gear, my plane cannot take off.

I just did a clean install & update to 1.4.4 and I'm seeing the low-tech fixed landing gear having major bouncing issues in my career save.  It doesn't seem to be related to craft weight - I've put them on a small rover & an aircraft and they both bounce severely.  I can't even recover the aircraft as it bounces enough for the game to think its still moving.  I even tried emptying the fuel tanks to drop the weight & it still bounces badly.  I want to do some more testing tonight because I don't know if it's related to your issue or not - a sandbox game doesn't seem to be having issues with the retractable gear and rover wheels seem fine.  I did try the World Stabilizer mod & it made no difference.

On 7/2/2018 at 10:06 AM, Gargamel said:

Different issue, but a possible fix. 

Xd, use smaller gear, they're usually less bouncy.   Also a good sized recent thread on this very topic with some good answers in it... that I cannot find to link for you.  It might have been by @Klapaucius, but I'm probably wrong there....

That was in reference to landing issues. The solution was re-angling the gear. However, with the new release, I have noticed stuff bouncing on the runway again for no good reason.  The bug is back.

So you tried messing with the spring and damper settings?

Like turn the spring strength up....to the right, and turn the damper down....to the left....
I wonder if I have to flare up, because  i dont and my large landing gear flips the plane over.
Im actually having this issue on 1.3.1, with the small landing gear(LY-10?)
